poem:
### An Official Gesture

Here, the ink dries on another edict,  
the weight of absurdity compressing  
words into a tight collar—  
banning what is already breath  
made manifest.  
The whispers in the office corridors  
carry traces of wonder,  
how paper pressed with power  
can wrinkle so much light  
into shadow.
